title: Awesome List Updates on Aug 22, 2019
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Aug 22, 2019 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Bioie
items.content_text:
### Research Overviews / Pre-LLM Overviews

*   [Literature Based Discovery: Models, methods, and trends](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1532046417301909) - A review of Literature Based Discovery (LBD), or the philosophy that meaningful connections may be found between seemingly unrelated scientific literature.
    *   For some historical context on LBD, see papers by University of Chicago's Don Swanson and Neil Smalheiser, including [*Undiscovered Public Knowledge*](https://www.jstor.org/stable/4307965) (paywalled) and [*Rediscovering Don Swanson: the Past, Present and Future of Literature-Based Discovery*](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5771422/).

### Tutorials / Pre-LLM Guides, Lectures, and Courses

*   [Coursera - Foundations of mining non-structured medical data](https://www.coursera.org/learn/mining-medical-data) - About three hours worth of video lectures on working with medical data of various types and structures, including text and image data. Appears fairly high-level and intended for beginners.
items.content_html:
Research Overviews / Pre-LLM Overviews

  • Literature Based Discovery: Models, methods, and trends - A review of Literature Based Discovery (LBD), or the philosophy that meaningful connections may be found between seemingly unrelated scientific literature.
    • For some historical context on LBD, see papers by University of Chicago's Don Swanson and Neil Smalheiser, including Undiscovered Public Knowledge (paywalled) and Rediscovering Don Swanson: the Past, Present and Future of Literature-Based Discovery.

Tutorials / Pre-LLM Guides, Lectures, and Courses

  • Coursera - Foundations of mining non-structured medical data - About three hours worth of video lectures on working with medical data of various types and structures, including text and image data. Appears fairly high-level and intended for beginners.

items.title: Awesome Pascal
items.content_text:
### Graphic

*   [OpenGL Pascal Toolkit (‚≠ê34)](https://github.com/daar/GLPT). `[FPC]` Easy to use native pascal toolkit that allows to create and manage OpenGL contexts in a platform independent way.
*   [BGRAbitmap (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/edivando-fpc/BGRABitmap). `[Delphi]` `[FPC]` Drawing routines with transparency and antialiasing with Lazarus. Offers also various transforms. These routines allow to manipulate 32bit images in BGRA format or RGBA format (depending on the platform).

### Control packs

*   [KControls (‚≠ê15)](https://github.com/ThomasJaeger/KControls). `[Delphi]` `[FPC]` Control components. All controls have been written with the aim to become both cross-IDE compatible (Delphi/C++Builder VCL and Lazarus LCL) and cross-platform compatible in Lazarus.
    // *Most useful are TKGrid with its DB-aware heritage TKDBGrid ‚Äî a very full-featured grid implementation incl. inplace editors. There's also hex editor, print preview, editors, labels, buttons etc.*

### Single controls

*   [zControls (‚≠ê154)](https://github.com/MahdiSafsafi/zcontrols). `[Delphi]` Contains TzObjectInspector - a powerful object inspector with many features.
*   [DzHTMLText (‚≠ê211)](https://github.com/digao-dalpiaz/DzHTMLText). `[Delphi]` `[FPC]` Visual component that allows you to specify a formatted text in a label, using almost the same syntax used in HTML code.

### Command-line

*   [TCommandLineReader (‚≠ê38)](https://github.com/benibela/rcmdline). `[Delphi]` `[FPC]` This unit provides an advanced, platform-independent command line parser for Lazarus and Delphi. It checks for allowed options, automatically prints a help with a list of all of them, and - contrary to the parser in the rtl - behaves the same on Windows and Linux.
*   [CommandLineParser (‚≠ê98)](https://github.com/VSoftTechnologies/VSoft.CommandLineParser). `[Delphi]` Simple Command Line Options Parser - spawned from the DUnitX Project.
*   [GpCommandLineParser (‚≠ê176)](https://github.com/gabr42/GpDelphiUnits/blob/master/src/GpCommandLineParser.pas). `[Delphi]` Attribute based command line parser.
*   [JPL.CmdLineParser (‚≠ê55)](https://github.com/jackdp/JPLib/blob/master/Base/JPL.CmdLineParser.pas). `[Delphi]` `[FPC]` Command-line parser for Delphi and Free Pascal

### Other non-visual

*   [PascalTZ (‚≠ê22)](https://github.com/dezlov/PascalTZ). `[FPC]` Pascal Time Zone allows you to convert between local times in various time zones and GMT/UTC, taking into account historical changes to time zone rules.

### Unit Testing

*   [OpenCTF](http://openctf.sourceforge.net). `[Delphi]` Test framework add-on for Embarcadero Delphi which performs automatic checks of all components in Forms (or DataModules). It provides an easy way to build automatic quality checks for large projects where many components have to pass repeated tests. OpenCTF is based on the DUnit open source test framework and extends it by specialized test classes and helper functions.

### RAD Studio IDE plugins/wizards

*   [RADSplit (‚≠ê36)](https://github.com/LaKraven/RADSplit). Dockable Split-Screen Editors for RAD Studio (Delphi and C++ Builder).
*   [DzNoteEditor (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/digao-dalpiaz/DzNoteEditor). Delphi Property Editor for TStrings supporting formatted languages with syntax highlight.

### Other

*   [Boss (‚≠ê560)](https://github.com/HashLoad/boss). Dependency Manager for Delphi projects.
items.content_html:
Graphic

  • OpenGL Pascal Toolkit (‚≠ê34). [FPC] Easy to use native pascal toolkit that allows to create and manage OpenGL contexts in a platform independent way.
  • BGRAbitmap (‚≠ê17). [Delphi] [FPC] Drawing routines with transparency and antialiasing with Lazarus. Offers also various transforms. These routines allow to manipulate 32bit images in BGRA format or RGBA format (depending on the platform).

Control packs

  • KControls (‚≠ê15). [Delphi] [FPC] Control components. All controls have been written with the aim to become both cross-IDE compatible (Delphi/C++Builder VCL and Lazarus LCL) and cross-platform compatible in Lazarus. // Most useful are TKGrid with its DB-aware heritage TKDBGrid ‚Äî a very full-featured grid implementation incl. inplace editors. There's also hex editor, print preview, editors, labels, buttons etc.

Single controls

  • zControls (‚≠ê154). [Delphi] Contains TzObjectInspector - a powerful object inspector with many features.
  • DzHTMLText (‚≠ê211). [Delphi] [FPC] Visual component that allows you to specify a formatted text in a label, using almost the same syntax used in HTML code.

Command-line

  • TCommandLineReader (‚≠ê38). [Delphi] [FPC] This unit provides an advanced, platform-independent command line parser for Lazarus and Delphi. It checks for allowed options, automatically prints a help with a list of all of them, and - contrary to the parser in the rtl - behaves the same on Windows and Linux.
  • CommandLineParser (‚≠ê98). [Delphi] Simple Command Line Options Parser - spawned from the DUnitX Project.
  • GpCommandLineParser (‚≠ê176). [Delphi] Attribute based command line parser.
  • JPL.CmdLineParser (‚≠ê55). [Delphi] [FPC] Command-line parser for Delphi and Free Pascal

Other non-visual

  • PascalTZ (‚≠ê22). [FPC] Pascal Time Zone allows you to convert between local times in various time zones and GMT/UTC, taking into account historical changes to time zone rules.

Unit Testing

  • OpenCTF. [Delphi] Test framework add-on for Embarcadero Delphi which performs automatic checks of all components in Forms (or DataModules). It provides an easy way to build automatic quality checks for large projects where many components have to pass repeated tests. OpenCTF is based on the DUnit open source test framework and extends it by specialized test classes and helper functions.

RAD Studio IDE plugins/wizards

  • RADSplit (‚≠ê36). Dockable Split-Screen Editors for RAD Studio (Delphi and C++ Builder).
  • DzNoteEditor (‚≠ê28). Delphi Property Editor for TStrings supporting formatted languages with syntax highlight.

Other

  • Boss (‚≠ê560). Dependency Manager for Delphi projects.
